description: Proposed basement extension with associated lightwell to front of the property; single storey rear extension; first floor extension including changes to existing outrigger; replacement of existing rear dormer windows; insertion of roof lights in the front and rear roof slopes and new plant.
decision_conditions:
<p>All new external facing and roofing materials in respect of all the works hereby approved (and any other incidental works carried out in this connection) shall match those of the existing building in respect of materials used, detailed execution and finished appearance including type, size, colour, bond, pointing, coursing, jointing, profile and texture (delete as appropriate)</p><p><br></p><p>

REASON: &nbsp;In order to preserve the character and appearance of the host building and&nbsp;<span id="docs-internal-guid-1826446d-7fff-6b1e-b64f-e857349a17fd"><span style="font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-position: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">Graham Road and Mapledene </span></span>Conservation Area.</p>

The Development hereby permitted shall only be carried out and completed strictly in accordance with the submitted plans hereby approved and any subsequent approval of details.


REASON: To ensure that the development hereby permitted is carried out in full accordance with the plans hereby approved.

The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date of this permission.


REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

<p>Prior to the first occupation of the development, details in the form of elevation plans and detailed specifications must be provided showing the installation of bee brick and/or swift/bird nesting box.</p><p>REASON: To enhance local biodiversity in accordance with Local Plan Policy LP47.</p>

<p>The roof of the rear extension hereby approved shall not be used as a terrace, balcony or similar amenity area.
</p><p>REASON: In the interests of neighbours amenity</p>

<p style="margin-bottom: 0px; font-stretch: normal; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-kerning: auto; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-position: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-optical-sizing: auto; font-variation-settings: normal;">Prior to the commencement of basement works, a scheme for the provision and implementation of flood resilient and resistant construction details and measures for the basement extension against groundwater flood risk shall be submitted to and agreed, in writing with the LPA in consultation with the LLFA prior to the construction of the measures. The scheme shall be carried out in its entirety before the basement extension is occupied and; constructed and completed in accordance with the approved plans in line with BS 8102:2022 Protection of below ground structures against water ingress - code of practice. Additionally, a&nbsp;dewatering&nbsp;plan shall be submitted and approved to manage groundwater during basement excavation. This plan must be implemented in accordance with best practices and approved by the LPA in consultation with the LLFA<br></p><p style="margin-bottom: 0px; font-stretch: normal; line-height: normal; font-size-adjust: none; font-kerning: auto; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-position: normal; font-feature-settings: normal; font-optical-sizing: auto; font-variation-settings: normal;">REASON: In the interest of flood risk mitigation.&nbsp;</p>

<p data-start="82" data-end="480">The&nbsp;Air Source Heat Pumps (ASHPs)&nbsp;shall operate at a noise level&nbsp;at least 5dB(A) below background levels&nbsp;when measured at any nearby residential window, in accordance with&nbsp;BS 4142:2014+A1:2019. The mitigation measures outlined in the&nbsp;Noise Impact Assessment dated 17 April 2024&nbsp;shall be fully implemented prior to first use of the ASHPs and maintained thereafter.</p><p data-start="482" data-end="693">The noise level from all&nbsp;plant and machinery&nbsp;associated with the approved development shall, at all times, remain&nbsp;at least 5dB(A) below background levels&nbsp;when measured at any nearby residential window.</p><p data-start="695" data-end="857">REASON:&nbsp;To protect the amenity of neighbouring occupiers by ensuring that noise emissions from the development do not cause undue disturbance or nuisance.</p>
